learning_outcomes.description: Apply practical skills to effectively conduct research in the field of biomedical sciences
Evaluate and analyse the theory behind different biomedical techniques
Explain the necessity for appropriate controls in research

assessments.task_description:
• Students will complete an online in-class quiz testing their knowledge of core practical skills for each module. Have your UQ student ID card available for all of your quizzes.
  • Further details of the assessment format and marking criteria will be provided on Blackboard during the semester.
  • This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Details of the quiz format and marking criteria will be provided on Blackboard during the semester.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Molecular Biology Module - Advanced Techniques Practical skills
assessments.task_description:
• Students will be assessed on their laboratory performance for this module. This will include their proficiency in performing the experiments and the documentation of their results in the lab book.
  • Further details of the assessment format and marking criteria will be provided on Blackboard during the semester.
  • This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment will be take place in students' scheduled practical sessions.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
• Students will be asked to solve a cloning problem drawing on theory learnt within the module and submit a written report.
  • Further details of the assessment format and marking criteria will be provided on Blackboard during the semester.
  • Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your Assessment task, with the electronic coversheet available on the Schools website (under Undergraduate - Assessment), to Turnitin by the submission deadline. You may submit drafts to Turnitin up to the due date, but you will only be able to submit once on or after the due date. You should also keep an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
P01 and P02 Molecular Biology [Millard]

Students will learn core and advanced skills in Molecular Biology. This module runs in weeks 1-5.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: P01 and P02 Molecular Biology [Millard] Students will learn core and advanced skills in Molecular Biology. This module runs in weeks 1-5.

learning_activities.topic:
P01 and P02 Thursday tutorials

This first Thursday of each module will consist of a quiz in the computer lab. The other 3 Thursdays are reserved for tutorials as needed (in a lecture theatre), but the academic leading each module will let students know when to meet.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
